title: TV presenter Laura Woods collapses live on air as she makes  weird  admission
body_text:
TV presenter Laura Woods collapses live on air as she makes 'weird' admission
Laura Woods was hosting the coverage of the England women's team's international friendly against Ghana at St Mary's Stadium on ITV4
Television host Laura Woods has reassured fans that she is "OK" following a live on-air collapse during ITV's coverage of a football match, causing worry among viewers.
Woods was anchoring the broadcast of the England women's team's international friendly against Ghana at St Mary's Stadium on ITV4, alongside Ian Wright and Anita Asante, when she suddenly fell forward, her co-hosts swiftly catching her.
ITV promptly switched to an advert break, and Woods was substituted by fellow presenter Katie Shanahan, who informed viewers that Woods had "taken ill".
According to PA news agency, Woods addressed the incident in an Instagram story post, stating: "Gosh that was a bit weird. Sorry to worry everyone, I'm OK, the wonderful paramedics at Saints have said it's probably a virus, just need a bit of rest and hydration."
Expressing embarrassment over the incident occurring on live television, Woods expressed gratitude towards her colleagues for their assistance, reports the Manchester Evening News.
Adam Collard, the 38 year old presenter's fiance, confirmed in a post on X that Woods was "all OK", expressing appreciation for the supportive messages received.
Woods is a regular face on ITV and TNT Sports, frequently presenting football match coverage.
Supporters at home were quick to send their well-wishes, and expressed concern.
One X user said: "Really hope Laura Woods is okay. Fair play to Ian Wright and Anita Asante for catching her. Fair play to the stand-in presenter who stepped in, some effort that."
"Upsetting to see Laura Woods faint," said another, "Glad @IanWright0 caught her. Speedy recovery"
"Gosh, I hope Laura Woods is okay?" added a further fan. "Just watching #lionesses #engvgha Bravo Katie Shanahan who has stepped in at a moment's notice."
"I hope that Laura Woods is okay... Seeing her go down like that wasn't good.... My heart goes out to her," said a viewer.
